div.style: flex-direction: column; margin-bottom: -5px; margin-top: -5px; display: flex; font-family: inherit;

span.class: oi732d6d ik7dh3pa d2edcug0 qv66sw1b c1et5uql a8c37x1j muag1w35 enqfppq2 jq4qci2q a3bd9o3v knj5qynh oo9gr5id hzawbc8m
span.style: line-height: 1.3333; display: block; overflow-wrap: break-word; max-width: 100%; margin-bottom: -4px; -webkit-font-smoothing: antialiased; font-size: 0.9375rem; margin-top: -4px; word-break: break-word; font-family: inherit; color: var(--primary-text);

div.class: kvgmc6g5 cxmmr5t8 oygrvhab hcukyx3x c1et5uql ii04i59q
div.style: overflow-wrap: break-word; margin: 0px; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: inherit;
div.div: Today, Governor Tate Reeves announced the closing of all public schools in Mississippi for the remainder of the semester. That means students and teachers will not be returning to their classrooms in the Harrison County School District for the rest of the 2019-20 school year. While this news is difficult for our school community, the decision is understandable and necessary in light of the ongoing COVID-19 coronavirus health emergency and the need to keep our students and staff healthy and safe.

div.class: o9v6fnle cxmmr5t8 oygrvhab hcukyx3x c1et5uql ii04i59q
div.style: overflow-wrap: break-word; margin: 0.5em 0px 0px; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: inherit;
div.div: We will continue to take guidance from the Governor and Mississippi Department of Education. We will be contacting our families with more information about how course credits, promotion, graduation, and other issues will be addressed over the next few weeks.

div.class: o9v6fnle cxmmr5t8 oygrvhab hcukyx3x c1et5uql ii04i59q
div.style: overflow-wrap: break-word; margin: 0.5em 0px 0px; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: inherit;
div.div: We are all moving through this experience at the same time, for the first time. Together, we will emerge from this crisis stronger and wiser. Thank you for your patience and support! Enjoy the remainder of your spring break! #HCSDStrong

div.class: o9v6fnle cxmmr5t8 oygrvhab hcukyx3x c1et5uql ii04i59q
div.style: overflow-wrap: break-word; margin: 0.5em 0px 0px; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: inherit;
div.div: Hoy, el gobernador Tate Reeves anunció el cierre de todas las escuelas públicas en Mississippi por el resto del semestre. Eso significa que los estudiantes y maestros no regresarán a sus clases en el Harrison County School District por el resto del año escolar 2019-20. Mientras esta noticia es difícil para nuestra comunidad escolar, la decisión es comprensible y necesaria a la luz de la emergencia de salud del coronavirus COVID-19 y la necesidad de mantener a nuestros estudiantes y empleados sanos y seguros.

div.class: o9v6fnle cxmmr5t8 oygrvhab hcukyx3x c1et5uql ii04i59q
div.style: overflow-wrap: break-word; margin: 0.5em 0px 0px; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: inherit;
div.div: Continuaremos tomando la guía del Gobernador y el Departamento de Educación de Mississippi. Nos contactaremos con nuestras familias con más información sobre cómo se abordarán los créditos del curso, la promoción, la graduación y otros temas en las próximas semanas.

div.class: o9v6fnle cxmmr5t8 oygrvhab hcukyx3x c1et5uql ii04i59q
div.style: overflow-wrap: break-word; margin: 0.5em 0px 0px; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: inherit;
div.div: Todos estamos avanzando a través de esta experiencia al mismo tiempo, por primera vez. Juntos, saldremos de esta crisis más fuertes y sabios. Gracias por su paciencia y apoyo! ¡Disfruta del resto de tus vacaciones de primavera!

img.alt: This is the image for the news article titled COVID-19 (Coronavirus) Information for HCSD Families

div.div: This page is dedicated to providing information to Harrison County School District families and the public regarding COVID-19 (Coronavirus), and the District's response to this global health emergency.
div.a: Read More about COVID-19 (Coronavirus) Information for HCSD Families

img.alt: This is the image for the news article titled HCSD Canceling 2020 Teacher Job Fair

div.div: In response to guidance from local, state, and federal health agencies regarding attending large events and mass gatherings during this time, the Harrison County School District has canceled its Teacher Job Fair on March 24, 2020.
div.a: Read More about HCSD Canceling 2020 Teacher Job Fair

img.alt: This is the image for the news article titled HCSD Schools Honored with 20 PREPS Awards

a.title: HCSD Schools Honored with 20 PREPS Awards

div.a: HCSD Schools Honored with 20 PREPS Awards
div.div: Harrison County School District received 20 PREPS value-added awards during a ceremony in Hattiesburg. The awards program recognized schools across Mississippi, based on the latest state assessments, along with school district ACT average test scores.
div.a: Read More about HCSD Schools Honored with 20 PREPS Awards

img.alt: This is the image for the news article titled HCSD Wins Governor’s Partnership Award

div.div: Harrison County School District won a major award at the Mississippi Association of Partners in Education (MAPE) Conference in Hattiesburg. On March 4, 2020, MAPE presented HCSD with the Governor’s Partnership Award for the district’s “Count Me In” Attendance Matters Campaign for 2018-19. The award celebrates the District’s successful partnership with over 25 community partners who joined forces to combat chronic absenteeism.
div.a: Read More about HCSD Wins Governor’s Partnership Award

img.alt: This is the image for the news article titled HCSD Receives Beacon Award for Excellence

a.title: HCSD Receives Beacon Award for Excellence

div.a: HCSD Receives Beacon Award for Excellence
div.div: Harrison County School District was recently honored with the Beacon Award for being an “A” rated district.
div.a: Read More about HCSD Receives Beacon Award for Excellence

img.alt: This is the image for the news article titled HCSD Honors Teacher, Administrator of Year

a.title: HCSD Honors Teacher, Administrator of Year

div.a: HCSD Honors Teacher, Administrator of Year
div.div: It was an exciting night as the Harrison County School Board honored the 2019-20 Teachers of the Year from each campus in the Harrison County School District! HCSD also announced the District Teacher of the Year and Administrator of the Year.
div.a: Read More about HCSD Honors Teacher, Administrator of Year

img.alt: This is the image for the news article titled Expansion & Renovation of North Gulfport Underway

a.title: Expansion & Renovation of North Gulfport Underway

div.a: Expansion & Renovation of North Gulfport Underway
div.div: You may have seen a lot of construction going on lately at North Gulfport Middle School. That’s because the expansion and renovation of the North Gulfport campus is officially underway.
div.a: Read More about Expansion & Renovation of North Gulfport Underway

img.alt: This is the image for the news article titled Three HCSD Teachers Win Ingalls Grants

a.title: Three HCSD Teachers Win Ingalls Grants

div.a: Three HCSD Teachers Win Ingalls Grants
div.div: Three teachers in the Harrison County School District received grants from Ingalls, totaling close to $10,500. The funds will be used to support classroom projects that will spark more interest in STEM.
div.a: Read More about Three HCSD Teachers Win Ingalls Grants

br.a: Free Summer Meals Program Interest Survey

span.br: The Harrison County School District Custom Mobile App is now live in the Apple App Store and Google Play Store!

span.strong: The app can be installed on your mobile device by going to the following links or by going to your app store and searching for “Harrison County School District.” Once the app is installed on your mobile device, just go to settings and choose the school or schools that you would like to receive news and other updates.
